Setting permissions for an object type
To configure access permissions by editing the object type profile (the
Object types registry
), you need to specify the
Permissions control type
. The System implements the following permissions control types:
No value is selected/All users have full access
All users are permitted to read
Controlling permissions of responsible employees
Inheriting permissions from a related object
System control of permissions
The
All users have full access
type permits reading and editing of an object type instance to all users. But the permission to create and delete an instance must be assigned separately (for more information, refer to
Setting permissions to create (edit) object types
). The data is available for viewing to all users of the System.
If you select the
Controlling permissions of responsible employees
, type, you need to edit access permissions in the process of setting up the Curation Matrix (for more information, refer to
Configuring permissions for a business process (Curation Matrix)
). In this case, access permissions are determined by those responsible for the object type. Including the permissions to delete a route object, which are issued to the author (initiator) before the generation of the first user task (according to the process settings) and to the manager.
The
Inheriting permissions from a related object
type borrows the access permissions of the parent object, which is selected in the
Inherit permissions attribute
(
Example
). If the user does not have the permissions to edit the parent object, the creation of child objects is automatically not allowed.
The
System control of permissions
regulates the ability to view and write an object instance. It can be configured in the System: ''Administration â†’ Access to system objects''. For more information, refer to
Configuring System permissions
. But the
permission to create and delete an instance
must be assigned separately (for more information, refer to
Setting permissions to create/edit object types
).
If you restrict access permissions to previously created object types, these restrictions will not apply to instances of this type that have already been created. The assigned permissions are applied when the object is created.
To apply newly assigned permissions to previously created instances of an object type, you need to ensure
Configuring the default permissions
.
To do this:
1. Click
in the Object type profile. The System will display the
Default permissions settings
form.
2. Specify access restrictions for object type instances. To add or delete access permissions of the user(s) and/or user groups, use the
Add group or user
button, and then specify permissions to read, write, and delete instances of the object type.
3. To save the changes, click
.
4. To apply the changes, click
. The System will request for confirmation:
5. Agree to apply the changes and click
Yes
.
